intro: Tonsella senegalensis, commonly known as the Senegalese tonsella, is a small shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats. Due to its medicinal properties, it is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
